intro: Rhododendron molle, commonly known as the sweet azalea, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it forms part of the understory vegetation. The leaves are leathery and elliptical, providing a lush green backdrop to its vibrant floral displays.
